subsection: States of Matter and Pure Substances
objective: Understand the nature of matter and its classifications.
content: Particulate nature of matter, states of matter, mixtures vs pure substances, and separation techniques.
specific_objectives: Describe the particulate nature of matter (atoms, molecules, ions)
Explain the differences between the states of matter in terms of kinetic energy and arrangement
Distinguish between elements, compounds, and mixtures
Identify various separation techniques (filtration, distillation, chromatography) and their applications
Differentiate between physical and chemical changes

objective: Analyze the structure of the atom and the organization of elements.
content: Atomic number, mass number, isotopes, and the periodic table (Groups and Periods).
specific_objectives: Decipher the structure of the atom: protons, neutrons, electrons
Define atomic number, mass number, and isotopes
List the characteristics of the Periodic Table
Determine electronic configurations of the first 20 elements
Analyze trends in Group 2 and Group 7 elements

objective: Understand how atoms interact to form compounds.
content: Ionic, covalent, and metallic bonding. Writing chemical formulas and balancing equations.
specific_objectives: Describe ionic bonding (electron transfer) and covalent bonding (electron sharing)
Identify properties of ionic and covalent compounds
Write chemical formulas using valency
Construct and balance chemical equations
State and apply the Law of Conservation of Mass

objective: Analyze the chemistry of carbon compounds.
content: Alkanes, Alkenes, Alcohols, and Organic Acids. Focuses on structure and reactions.
specific_objectives: Define 'Homologous Series'
Identify the general formulas and structures of alkanes and alkenes
Distinguish between saturated and unsaturated hydrocarbons
Describe the reactions of alcohols (ethanol) and organic acids (ethanoic acid)
Explain the concept of 'polmerization' (addition and condensation)

objective: Evaluate the properties and uses of inorganic substances.
content: Reactivity series, extraction of metals, and chemistry of non-metals (Nitrogen, Sulfur).
specific_objectives: Compare the physical and chemical properties of metals and non-metals
Analyze the Reactivity Series of metals
Describe the extraction of iron (Blast Furnace) and aluminum (Electrolysis)
Discuss the uses and properties of common non-metals and their compounds
Identify common gases (Oxygen, Hydrogen, Carbon Dioxide) using laboratory tests
